data.title: Love this place
data.text: I lived in CA for many years ago while back. I really, really miss this place and love their fish tacos.

data.title: This is another place with healthy fast food that is very good
data.text: Rubio's is one of our choices when we have a limited amount of time to eat. The food is good and the prices are reasonable.  I enjoy the lobster burrito and my wife enjoys the fish tacos.

data.title: fast food mexican style
data.text: this is a mexican style fast food mcdonalds , quick orders and standard fountain drinks there is a bathroom but its shared by other businesses

data.title: Good value, fast food Mexican
data.text: Enjoyed Rubios several times in Mesa Arizona.  They make a nice product for a good price. The fish tacos are as good as we have had in many more expensive restaurants.  The sides are also quite nicely done.  If you are looking for fast food Mexican this is much better than a Taco Bell etc type place. Staff friendly.  We shared a combo platter and they thoughtfully put it on two plates, no extra charge

data.title: Love The Fish Tacos!
data.text: Rubios is where I go when I am in the mood for fish tacos. The first time I ever had a fish taco was when I was a kid down in Baja, Mexico where we used to go camping on the beach every year for Easter vacation. I have to say their tacos taste pretty close to the tacos I would get in Baja. They are so crispy and delicious, the white sauce they put on them is so good. I have also had their burritos, which are not bad, but for me it's all about the fish tacos!

data.title: Not Really
data.text:
I will explain exactly why they deserve only 2 Stars. I purposefully ordered a steak burrito combo. Upon receiving the order I proceeded to open the burrito very carefully to find out the ratio of meat versus the rest. I was more than disappointed when I counted the tiny bit of beef, which could have been more than an oz all together, and the large servings of the rest: rice, beans, etc. This is what separates a seriously good place from a money making formula. Yes, they are slightly better than other mexican franchises like del taco, taco bell (notice I am not bothering with capital letters? Is my way of showing contempt to the big corporations and my bad taste for going there). I also tried their fish tacos and have to say that there is nothing south of the border on these offerings. Rare is the place that will serve you fare that is above average. Across the street In and Out was booming with people coming and going. Why? Because they serve a product that does not deviate in quality, quantity and price.
Rubio was popularized by the illusive image of baja and the beautiful pacific ocean. These are great images to associate with their business, but in reality Rubio makes slightly better beans, better sauces than the competition. Their food is mediocre and the reason this location does good is because it attends to the mall traffic. Seriously, I counted maybe ten miniature pieces of beef that amounted to no more than an oz of beef, it that. That is the model for this eatery, and come to think of it, for most places. Very little meat, lots of everything else. For their trickery only 2 Stars.

data.title: 他のファストフードよりいい
data.text: カリフォルニアにはタコベルやデルタコなど、たくさんのメキシカンファストフード店が点在しますが、ここの店は他の店より上質で、具がたくさん入っていると思います。その分お値段も割高ですが、多少高くてもこの店のタコスがいいと思います。
